summary: This is a US Marshals Service Prisoner Schedule Report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 9, 2019. It lists prisoners being transferred or produced for court appearances, detailing their names, offenses, and special cautions. The document is significant as it provides a snapshot of the prison population and logistics at MCC New York, the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held, around the time of his death.

events.title: MCC New York Prisoner Schedule
events.description: US Marshals Service schedules multiple prisoners for transfers, medical summaries, court appearances (sentencing, status hearings, change of plea, revocation hearings) at MCC New York.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York
locations.context: Federal detention facility located at 500 Pearl St., Manhattan, where the listed prisoners are held and scheduled for court production.

locations.name: 500 Pearl St. (Manhattan)
locations.context: Address of the MCC New York facility.

keyFacts: This document is a routine prisoner schedule report from MCC New York dated August 9, 2019, showing no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.
The report details standard prison logistics including transfers for medical summaries and productions for various court proceedings like sentencing and status hearings.
It lists numerous 'separatee warnings,' indicating inmates who must be kept apart from each other for security reasons.
The document provides insight into the general inmate population and operational procedures at MCC New York around the time Epstein was incarcerated there.
